noun.description: Any of several small eucalypts of south-western Australia similar to mallees.

verb.description: To frolic, dance; to play about.

origin: Late 19th century. From Nyungar (Perth–Albany region) marlok<br>mid 19th century; earliest use found in Elizabeth Gaskell (1810–1865), novelist and short-story writer. Probably from marlock, unless the reverse is in fact the case.
